challengeName: Fetal Growth Monitoring - Web Portal Functionality Additions
detailedRequirements:
INTRODUCTION
This is the next challenge in a series to develop an iOS app and web portal for Total Mama in partnership with the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation to track maternal health and fetal growth and development during pregnancy.

Total Mama is a new digital health company started and incubated at the University of Oxford whose goal is to provide women with personalized, evidence-based health information on pregnancy and fertility.

The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation’s Healthy Birth, Growth, and Development knowledge integration (HBGDki) initiative seeks to develop data-driven strategies to accelerate the foundation’s ability to promote healthy birth, growth, and development, in the communities that need it most, by delivering the right interventions to the right child, at the right time, and at the right price.

REQUIREMENTS
For this challenge we will be adding new functionality to the web portal, including the ability to add/edit maternal and fetal measurements, newborn tracking and data export capabilities. You’ll be updating the existing web portal prototype with the functionality, changes and updates outlined below.  Use mock data for display as web services integration will be completed in a follow up challenge.

Global Functionality
-- All data entry forms are displayed as modal dialogs
-- All modal dialogs are the same size on desktop and mobile
-- All measurements and dates must display in metric or imperial, depending upon the user’s preference which will be specified on the pregnancy or newborn via web services
-- On the added newborn screens, include animations to match maternal and fetal views

Data Sharing Consent Screen
-- Display this screen prior to the profile creation screen
-- The user can opt to skip this consent and turn it on later from their profile

Login
-- On login, if there are no active pregnancies or newborns, and there are archived pregnancies or newborns, the user will be displayed a modal to:
    -- Create New Pregnancy
    -- View Archived Timelines
    -- These should be large blue buttons at the bottom of the modal
    -- Navigate the user to the proper screen dependent upon their selection
-- For this challenge, provide a simple way to test this functionality

Profile Creation Screen
-- Tapping the camera icon should prompt for selecting a photo
-- Displayed as a modal dialog with data entry fields for:
    -- First Name (free text)
    -- Last Name (free text)
    -- Email Address
    -- Password (secure)
    -- Confirm Password (secure)
    -- Height (length/number picker)
    -- Date of Birth (date picker)
-- Validate all fields are completed before creating an account
-- Validate passwords match

My Gallery Screens
-- Maintain the existing zoom functionality when an image is clicked
-- Add the ability to share the image to Facebook (desktop and mobile) or Instagram (mobile)
    -- When possible, have the share links open native apps on the devices

Menu
-- Change the “Pregnancies” menu item to read “Timelines”
-- Replace the Log Out link with the user’s full name which will open a new menu (desktop)
-- Add “Edit Pregnancy” item
    -- Change to “Edit Newborn” if the active timeline is for a newborn
    -- This should display the edit pregnancy or edit newborn modal
-- Add “Edit Profile” item, which will open the Profile Edit modal
-- Add “Export Data” item, which will open the Export Data modal

Pregnancy List Screen
-- This list is being renamed to “Timelines”
-- Update the list to include display of both pregnancies and newborns

Create/Edit Pregnancy Modal
-- Accessed from the “Edit Pregnancy” link in the menu
-- Displayed as a modal dialog with data entry fields for:
    -- Estimated Due Date (date picker)
    -- Pre-pregnancy Weight (weight/number picker)
    -- Measurements (radio, metric/imperial)
    -- Is this your first pregnancy? (checkbox, yes/no)
    -- Number of babies expected (number picker)
-- Validate all fields are completed before submitting changes
-- Editing mode should allow:
    -- Deletion of the pregnancy (prompt user first)
    -- Completion of the pregnancy (prompt user first)
-- “Add newborn tracking?”
        -- This field may only be completed when “Complete Pregnancy” is clicked
        -- Display a modal for adding a newborn if the checkbox for tracking is selected and the user completes the pregnancy

Maternal Timeline Screen
-- Include a new “Add Measurements” button
    -- Clicking will display a modal dialog with data entry of the following elements
        -- Date (date picker)
        -- Maternal Weight (weight/number picker)
        -- Tummy Image (optional)
    -- Validate all required fields are completed before submitting measurement
-- Clicking a measurement in the list allows editing of the entry with the same fields as above
-- Replace the existing graphs with the correct ones from the iOS app located here

Fetal Timeline Screen
-- Include a new “Add Measurements” button
    -- Clicking will display a modal dialog with data entry steps for:
            -- Date (date picker)
            -- Fetal Head Circumference (length/number picker)
            -- Fetal Abdominal Circumference (length/number picker)
            -- Fetal Femur Length (length/number picker)
            -- Ultrasound Image (optional)
    -- Validate all required fields are completed before submitting measurement
    -- Display the tutorial screen on the first access of the timeline entry steps
-- Clicking a measurement in the list allows editing of the entry with the same fields as above
-- Replace the existing graphs with the correct ones from the iOS app located here

Create/Edit Newborn Screen
-- Form should have similar functionality to adding/editing a pregnancy
-- Tapping the camera icon should prompt for selecting a photo
-- Displayed as a modal dialog with data entry fields for:
    -- Birth Date (date picker)
    -- Name (free text)
    -- Birth Weight (number/weight picker)
    -- Sex (radio, male/female)
    -- Head Circumference (number/length picker)
    -- Crown to Heel Length (number/length picker)
-- Validate all fields are completed before saving the newborn
-- Editing mode should allow:
    -- Deletion of the newborn (prompt user first)
    -- Completion of newborn tracking (prompt user first)

Newborn Timeline/Gallery Screens
-- This screen functions/displays data in a similar manner to the maternal and fetal timelines.  Use those screens for functionality and display reference.
-- Display the newborn’s first year progress on the top left (desktop) or top (mobile) of the screen
-- Display the newborn’s image on the top right (desktop) or top (mobile) of the screen
-- Display all measurements on the left (desktop) or top (mobile) of the screen
    -- Clicking a measurement allows editing of the entry
-- Display measurement graphs on the right (desktop) or top (mobile) of the screen
    -- Use Highcharts to display timeline entries
-- Males and females have different growth standards, so you’ll need 4 charts total
    -- Male, metric
    -- Male, imperial
    -- Female, metric
    -- Female, imperial
-- Use the WHO data tables located here for growth standards
-- Maternal and fetal graphs can be used for display and functionality reference
-- Clicking “Add Measurements” will display a modal dialog with data entry steps for:
    -- Date (date picker)
    -- Newborn Head Circumference (number/length picker)
    -- Newborn Weight (number/weight picker)
    -- Crown to Heel Length (number/length picker)
    -- Image (optional)
-- Clicking “My Gallery” will display all uploaded images associated with the newborn
    -- This functions/displays images similar to the maternal and fetal galleries
-- Clicking the newborn’s name will return to the timeline view

Newborn Timeline Entry Modal
-- Displayed as a modal dialog with data entry steps for:
    -- Date (date picker)
    -- Head Circumference (number/length picker)
    -- Weight (number/weight picker)
    -- Crown to Heel Length (number/length picker)
    -- Image (optional)
-- Measurements in metric/imperial should be based on the user’s preference as is elsewhere in the app
-- Maternal and fetal timeline entries can be used for reference

Data Export Modal
-- Accessed from the “Export Data” link in the menu
-- Displayed as a modal dialog with CSV and PDF options
-- For this challenge have the Export button close the dialog

SETUP
-- See the challenge forums for details on adding yourself to the Total-Mama GitLab group
-- Fork the Web repository and use the tc_2 branch for the basis of development
-- Add harrywynn as a member of your forked repository with Reporter access
-- All necessary designs and source files can be found in the Resources repository
-- Reference the iOS app for functionality when necessary
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
-- All new and updated screens developed according to the provided design and as described above
-- All source code from your project uploaded as a zip
